meanings.definition: A melody sung or played above the main melody.
meanings.sent1: The descant added a beautiful harmony to the song.
meanings.sent2: She sang the descant part in the choir performance.
meanings.sent3: The descant seemed to dance around the main melody.
meanings.sent4: The descant was like a colorful ribbon woven through the music.
meanings.sent5: The sweet sound of the descant lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: To sing or play a descant.
meanings.sent1: I will descant along with the choir during the concert.
meanings.sent2: They decided to descant together on the final chorus.
meanings.sent3: He loves to descant whenever he hears his favorite song.
meanings.sent4: Her voice descanted beautifully, adding depth to the music.
meanings.sent5: Descanting with passion, she filled the room with music.
